text: this recipe for chocolate almond oat
bars is like the best energy bar you've
ever had but it's packed full of great
ingredients and best part is requires no
baking everything happens in this pot
and in the refrigerator get started
third of a cup of honey into the pot I'm
going to melt this along with one stick
of butter and one cup of almond butter
this is a natural almond butter you
could also use a natural peanut butter
or a natural cashew butter this goes on
to the stove to melt everything together
the medium heat takes about six minutes
and you don't want to leave this alone
because that honey could burn we just
want to make sure this is warm enough so
that we add the chocolate it will melt
into the mixture now we get to add all
the good bits first half a cup of whole
almonds toasted and chopped then 6
ounces of chopped bittersweet chocolate
give it a stir and then three-quarters
cup of raisins and two cups of
old-fashioned oats this is really going
to help bind everything together and add
a lot of great nutrition for mix this
whole bit together and that's it that is
the entire cooking of these bars and to
bring out all the flavors a 1/2 teaspoon
of coarse salt once it's all combined
it's going to go into the pan I have an
8-inch square pan I find that if I spray
it and line it with parchment it's
really easy to pull them out later once
they're chilled so just quick spray a
cut piece of parchment just going to
line the bottom up the sides make sure
it's flat and then one great little
trick some binder clips these just help
hold the parchment down on the side so
they don't flop over onto the batter and
then this mixture goes right in it looks
and smells so good all that melted
chocolate
spread this out just want an even layer
but I like to leave it kind of bumpy on
the top and this goes into the fridge to
chill just until it's firm enough to cut
or you could store it in there for up to
a week good to go right into the fridge
okay the bars are out of the fridge
they look great they're nice and set and
firm so now we can remove them from the
pan the two sides without the parchment
I'm just going to run my knife along the
side so they'll be able to pop out
easier remove these great binder clips
use the parchment to pull it out just
ease this right out here it comes
okay I like to stand it up so I can
remove the parchment just like that so
now from here you can do small squares
or bars or whatever size you like see
that inside with the great oats and
raisins and nuts in there that chocolaty
base these are going to disappear really
quickly I think they're great for a
lunchbox anytime you need a little
energy pick-me-up these are perfect so
good so delicious and so good for you
and there's no baking involved give them
a try and there's no baking involved
you
you
